data.title: State Government
data.meta_description: Learn about Virginia state government, the branches that compose it, and how it can help you.
data.text:
The Commonwealth Calendar displays public meetings of Virginia government entities in a calendar format. Each listing displays date and time of the meeting, includes a map of location and a contact person for the meeting at the sponsoring entity, and allows users to add meetings of interest to their own calendars.

Virginia state government agencies develop and implement Strategic Plans for their agency and for relevant programs and service areas. Agencies also identify Performance Measures to track their performance on achieving their strategic plan objectives. View agency strategic plans and objectives online and track their progress.

The Auditor of Public Accounts (APA) serves Virginia citizens and decision-makers by providing unbiased, accurate information and sound recommendations to improve accountability and financial management of public funds. It is part of the legislative branch of Virginia government and reports through the Joint Legislative Audit and Review Commission (JLARC) of the General Assembly. This structure provides independence from the executive and judicial branch agencies it audits. View financial reports and audits for public accounts, report fraud or review procedural documents.

Your source for information about proposed changes to Virginiaâ€™s regulations including a meetings calendar and board minutes. Participate in online forums or sign up to receive email alerts.

Open data is non-sensitive, public information that is made freely available for public use in an easily readable format. Virginia has an online portal that provides both easy access to Virginia's open data and keeps Virginians informed of major Commonwealth initiatives that utilize big data.
